title: Kongstedlund
text:
Kongstedlund is an old <a href="Denmark">Danish</a> <a href="manor%20house">manor house</a> built in 1592 in the <a href="Renaissance">Renaissance-style</a> and situated on the peninsula of <a href="Himmerland">Himmerland</a> near <a href="Aalborg">Aalborg</a>. Kongstedtlund is not open to the public, but the building can be seen from the nearby road.
Architecture.
Kongstedlund was built on the foundations of an ancient, storied <a href="castle">castle</a>, and is surrounded by drained <a href="moat">moat</a>s. The main building was constructed in 1592 for the <a href="Danish%20nobility">Danish nobleman</a> Niels Juul. In 1640, a <a href="sandstone">sandstone</a> <a href="Portal%20%28architecture%29">portal</a> in the <a href="Baroque">Baroque</a>-style was added to the entrance of the main building by the owners of the property, Ivar Krabbe and Dorte Juul. In the 1770s, a low <a href="Timber%20framing">half-timbered</a> wing was attached to the main building. Kongstedtlund rests upon an old arched <a href="Vault%20%28architecture%29">vault</a> that has remained as part of the older construction. The mansion's facades are now whitewashed, but were originally made unpainted brick. The levels of the main building are marked by <a href="anchor%20plate">anchor plate</a>s. The rectangle windows are embedded in curved window slots. The <a href="gable">gable</a>s are now adjusted to the saddle roof in a straight line, but were originally probably arched in the style of the Renaissance. The baroque sandstone portal with the <a href="initial">initial</a>s of the owners by that time, Ivar Krabbe and Dorte Juul, is a particularly precious architectural detail.
The most prominent elements of the portal are the <a href="sculpture">sculpture</a>s of two <a href="warrior">warrior</a>s in full armour framing the entrance, as well as those of two <a href="angel">angel</a>s, on which the uppermost part of the portal rests, and two female figures in the upper part which are framing a family <a href="coat%20of%20arms">coat of arms</a> and a <a href="laurel%20wreath">laurel wreath</a>.
Royal inhabitant.
From 1922 to 1961, <a href="Princess%20Dagmar%20of%20Denmark">Princess Dagmar of Demark</a>, the daughter of <a href="Frederick%20VIII%20of%20Denmark">Frederick VIII of Denmark</a> and <a href="Louise%20of%20Sweden">Louise of Sweden</a>, lived on Kongstedlund. She was married to the <a href="squire">squire</a> Jorgen Castenskiold, <a href="Hofj%C3%A6germester">hunting master of the Danish court</a> and member of the ennobled Danish family Castenskiold.
See also.
